sentences: Fred E. White (born Frederick Eugene Adams; January 13, 1955 in Chicago, Illinois) is an American drummer.
He was one of the early members of Earth, Wind & Fire.
He previously played drums on Donny Hathaway's Live album.
Earth, Wind & Fire consisting of Fred White along with half-brother Maurice White, brother Verdine White, and other members were inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame in 2000.
La La Time – The Salty Peppers (tambourine)
Do It Like Mama – Simtec & Wylie (drums)
Pass It On – Pieces of Peace (drums)
Mama Said Thank You – Albertina Walker (drums)
Extension Of A Man – Donny Hathaway (drums)
1974: Feats Don't Fail Me Now – Little Feat (drums, songwriter)
Heart Like A Wheel - Linda Ronstadt - drums
That's The Way Of The World – Earth, Wind & Fire (drums)
All n' All – Earth, Wind & Fire (drums, percussion, songwriter)
Blues For The Night Owl – Ramsey Lewis (percussion)
